thing-type.label: Tag Reader Tag Reader
thing-type.description: Tag Reader<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtBasic operations</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtThe Tag Reader 500 is a security enabled Z-Wave Plus product.</li&gt <li&gtThe Tag Reader 500 can arm/disarm a security system.</li&gt <li&gtThe Tag Reader 500 can read RFID-tags.</li&gt <li&gtThe Tag Reader 500 has the possibility for the user to manually insert codes.</li&gt <li&gtThe Tag Reader 500’s indicator light will react differently on each action.</li&gt <li&gtThe Tag Reader 500 has a buzzer, which can be used as walk-in/walk-out notification (alarm is being disabled/activated).</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtPress and hold the enter button for two seconds (indication LED blinks shortly) and release to start the add routine.</li&gt <li&gtThe indication LED will start blinking twice when the Tag Reader 500 starts the add routine.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtPress and hold the enter button for two seconds (indication LED blinks shortly) and release to start the remove routine.</li&gt <li&gtThe indication LED will blink 3 times when the Tag Reader 500 starts the remove routine</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtThe enter button is pressed for 4 seconds. (led will go on for 1 second to confirm).</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Set to Default
parameter.description: Set all configuration values to default values (factory settings)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf the Value is set to 0xFF (255) this device will return to factory settings.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Feedback time
parameter.description: the time the beep goes to off<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0x00 = Off, 0xFF = endless</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Feedback time-out
parameter.description: waiting for the wake-up-no-more command<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtToo configure the time-out, waiting on the wakeup_no_more_information command before the error sound starts automatically. The error sound is set to 8 short beeps.</p&gt <p&gt0x00 = off</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: feedback beeps per second
parameter.description: Amount of beeps a second<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTo set the amount of beeps per second, every beep is around 10ms.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Mode
parameter.description: To configure mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtMode 1 = normal working mode</p&gt <p&gtMode 3 = z-wave chip is always on to be asked for information, for example version or manufacturer ID.</p&gt <p&gtAny other value will be reported after a GET, but will be seen as a mode 1.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1
parameter.label: 6: RFID circuit start-up time
parameter.description: The time the RFID will be started after pressing "home" or "away"<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0x64 (100 * 10 ms = 1 s)</p&gt <p&gtThe time (*10 ms) the RFID circuit waits to start after "home" or "away" has been pressed.</p&gt <p&gtthe time *10 miliseconds, minimum = 0 seconds, max = 2,55 seconds. If the value is not in the allowed size the frame will be ignored.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Association group 1
parameter.description: Link devices to the tag reader<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThis class can be used to link other devices to the tag reader. These devices also get the burglar frame send to them.</p&gt
